diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The final diagnosis of pseudopseudohypoparathyroidism was confirmed based on the patient's physical examination showing short stature and characteristic hand abnormalities (shortened fourth and fifth fingers, absence of knuckles), alongside normal serum calcium and phosphate levels and intact parathyroid hormone (PTH) levels. These findings aligned with the features of pseudopseudohypoparathyroidism as opposed to pseudohypoparathyroidism, which would involve PTH resistance.
